scenario_text.value:
(After Aoi turned into Plutomon and
disappeared...)

(...we returned to the school to recover and
tell Jijimon and the others what happened.)

(Jijimon seemed taken aback by the looks on
all our faces when we returned.)
(And I can see why.)

(None of us said anything out loud, but we
all felt conflicted and full of doubts.)

Oh my... To think that she would fuse with
Labramon and so become Plutomon...
We were all really surprised too.

I still can’t believe it. I can’t believe Aoi
would turn into something like that...

Yeah. She kept going on about making the
world one and about correcting mistakes.

She really blames herself for not being able
to save Saki. When Saki let go at the end...
...that really messed Aoi up.

I know I told Aoi she should think of what
Saki wanted when she let go,

but I guess losing Saki that way, with each
of them trying to save the other,

was too painful for Aoi to accept. Maybe
that’s why things happened the way they did.

I guess I just didn’t understand what Aoi was
going through.
Kaito...

Aoi said she wanted humans and monsters to
join together and share the same feelings.
You all heard her, right?

Yeah, she was real mad at us for only
thinking of ourselves all the time.
Has she really felt that way this whole time?
I...do not believe she has.

While Aoi did repeatedly urge cooperation,
she was never distanced from you.

That’s how I feel too. Aoi was always
worrying about us.

Right. I think she’s still worried about
what’s going to happen to us, and the world.
You know, maybe you’re right.

Yeah... I’m sure it’s just that she’s chosen
an extreme path.

But that doesn’t mean we have to agree with
the answer she’s found,

or go along with what she’s trying to do. No,
we need to stop her!

Exactly. We need to do whatever we can to
stop Aoi.
Yeah! So let’s all go find Aoi and—

Uh, Agumon... Was that your stomach
grumbling?
Ahaha! I guess I’m pretty hungry!

Now that you mention it, so am I... We never
stopped to eat while we were looking for Aoi.

Ho ho ho... Then why don’t you all have some
food before you go?

Sounds good to me! After all, it’s hard to
fight on an empty stomach!

While I’d like to say we don’t have time,
I agree that we need to recover our stamina.

And it seems like the professor, er, Haru,
had the same thought.
(Oh yeah, where did the professor go?)

I imagined you’d all be hungry, so while it’s
not much, I made you something to eat.
Wow! Look at all that food!
Whoa! When did you make all this?!

Actually, I’ve been working on it ever since
you started looking for Aoi.
I wanted to find some way to help you.
Really? I never even noticed.

I’ve relied on all of you so much, I thought
this was the least I could do.

I’m sure it won’t be as good as Aoi’s
cooking, but...why don’t you all have some?

All right, let’s dig in, get our strength
back, then go out there and find Aoi!

Hey, not so fast! This is going to be our
last meal here. We might as well savor it!

Oh, huh... This really is the last meal we’ll
be eating here, isn’t it?
(That’s right. This is it.)

(After this meal, we’ll be heading out for
the last time.)

Here, Miu, let me share some of mine with
you, since you’re still growing.

Knock it off! That’s just your excuse to make
me eat the stuff you don’t like!

Well, we don’t know when our next meal is
going to be. You should eat all you can.

All the more reason you should eat it
yourself.

What are we going to do if we’re in a fight
and you run out of steam? After all, I...
I count on you, okay?

Miu... You really mean that? You trust me to
take care of you?!
Ugh... Stop being so mushy! It’s gross!

(Is it just me, or is everyone starting to
look more cheerful again?)

(Actually, with the final fight ahead, they
must all be putting on a brave face.)

(I should do that too. Do my best to enjoy
this meal with a smile!)

(After all, this may not only be our last
meal here, but the last food we ever eat.)
Here goes nothing... *gulp*... Eugh!
*cough* *gag* P-Professor? What is this?!
Shut up, you idiot! Not so loud!
Aw man, so much for keepin’ our mouths shut.
Takuma, can’t you be more considerate?

(Wait, why’s everybody ganging up on me all
of a sudden?)

I’m sorry. It sounds like I really messed up
the recipe. And this is our last meal, too...
Wow, the professor is really upset!
I forgot how badly he takes criticism.

Uh, wait, no! I just...wasn’t expecting it to
taste like this! It’s really not bad!
Heh... Heheheh... Hahahahahaha!
Uh... Takuma?

I’m sorry, it’s just... You had the funniest
look on your face!

Ha... Hahaha. Well, if nothing else, this
last meal certainly has been memorable.
I...never expected it would be this bad.
The flavor is quite...stimulating.

This is awful! But I’ll still eat every bite!
After all, the professor made this for us!

(The professor’s food really is bad...but it
also got everyone smiling, and that’s good.)

(Seeing everyone’s reactions though, I can’t
help but think about Aoi.)
I wonder what Aoi would say about this.

Yeah, I wonder. I’d have liked to make her
try some if I could.

I can’t believe she’s not here for this. Talk
about bad timing.

Knowing Aoi, I bet she’d have eaten it with
a smile.

Yeah, then she’d have done something to make
it taste better without anyone noticing.

(I shouldn’t have said anything. That brought
everyone down just as they were cheering up.)
(Still, I couldn’t help it.)

(And I have to wonder, how are we supposed to
react to what Aoi’s trying to do?)

Aoi says she wants to save the world...but
she’s going to wind up destroying everything.

Yes...by taking down the Master who sustains
this world.
You know, I’ve been thinking...

If Aoi does take him out, wouldn’t that mean
we’re saved?

No. If she defeats the Master, there’s no
saying how our world will be affected.

Besides, the way she is now, Aoi has no
intention of rescuing Miyuki from the Master.

And her wish is to destroy everything. Who
knows what would become of us.
Don’t say that!

Not after we brought so many of the little
ones here from the amusement park.

I wish we could show Aoi their faces when
they’re sleeping. That might change her mind.

Heheh, you’re right! Even now, they all look
so happy, dreaming their little dreams!
Yeah, if only it were that easy.

In Aoi’s current frame of mind, it might only
increase her desire to destroy.

Right. She thinks to bring peace she’s gotta
destroy this world and make everything one.
Well, that sounds pretty bad to me.

I don’t want to see Aoi destroy the world,
and I don’t want to be one with everyone!
I want to stay with Takuma the way I am now!
Agumon...

I want to stay with you the way I am now,
too.

(Which means there really is only one way for
us to react. We can’t let Aoi have her way.)

Right! Enough of that! We need to eat! After
all, there’s no fighting on an empty stomach!

Come on, Miu! Keep eating! Eat until you
croak! Ugh, this is so bad!
Kaito, shut up already!
Hey! I was going to eat that!

You know, the more of this I eat, the better
it tastes!

Yeah, you’re right! I’m gonna eat all I can
stomach!

(Yes... What we need to do is to keep moving
forward! And stop Aoi no matter what!)
(Even if that means we have to fight her.)

(We can’t afford to run away from that.
Really, there’s nowhere left to run.)

(After we finished eating, we left the little
ones in Jijimon’s care...)

(then we all bid a brief farewell to the run-
down school that was our home,)

(and set out for the small <color=#B41919>shrine</color> where Aoi,
the Master, and Miyuki were all waiting.)
